title: LC circuit - relative L and Vmax in two circuits

content.question: Two circuits, <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are constructed using a charged capacitor, an inductor, an ammeter, and a voltmeter, as shown. The capacitance of the capacitor in Circuit <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is less than the capacitance of the capacitor in Circuit <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The inductors in circuits <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> have inductances <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. The ammeters in each circuit measure the same angular frequency and maximum current. The voltmeters in circuits <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> measure the maximum potential differences <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively, across each inductor. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext>max</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="L sub 1 is greater than L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum is greater than delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 1 is greater than L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum is less than delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 1 is less than L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum is greater than delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub 1 is less than L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum is less than delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub 1 is less than L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub 1 comma maximum is less than delta V sub 2 comma maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>max</mi></mrow></msub></math>

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
